description: Manage express route cross connection peering.

commands.name: az network cross-connection peering create
commands.summary: Create peering settings for an express route cross connection.
commands.syntax:
az network cross-connection peering create --cross-connection-name
                                           --peer-asn
                                           --peering-type {AzurePrivatePeering, AzurePublicPeering, MicrosoftPeering}
                                           --primary-peer-subnet
                                           --resource-group
                                           --secondary-peer-subnet
                                           --vlan-id
                                           [--advertised-public-prefixes]
                                           [--customer-asn]
                                           [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                           [--routing-registry-name {AFRINIC, ALTDB, APNIC, ARIN, LACNIC, LEVEL3, RADB, RIPENCC}]
                                           [--shared-key]
examples: az network cross-connection peering create -g MyResourceGroup --cross-connection-name MyCircuit --peering-type MicrosoftPeering --peer-asn 10002 --vlan-id 103 --primary-peer-subnet 101.0.0.0/30 --secondary-peer-subnet 102.0.0.0/30 --advertised-public-prefixes 101.0.0.0/30

commands.name: az network cross-connection peering delete
commands.syntax:
az network cross-connection peering delete [--cross-connection-name]
                                           [--ids]
                                           [--name]
                                           [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                           [--resource-group]
                                           [--subscription]
                                           [--yes]
examples: az network cross-connection peering delete -g MyResourceGroup --cross-connection-name MyCircuit -n AzurePrivatePeering

commands.name: az network cross-connection peering list
commands.summary: List peering settings of an express route cross connection.
examples: az network cross-connection peering list -g MyResourceGroup --cross-connection-name MyCircuit

commands.name: az network cross-connection peering show
commands.summary: Show the details of an express route peering.
examples: az network cross-connection peering show -g MyResourceGroup --cross-connection-name MyCircuit -n AzurePrivatePeering

commands.name: az network cross-connection peering update
commands.summary: Update peering settings for an express route cross connection.
commands.syntax:
az network cross-connection peering update [--add]
                                           [--advertised-public-prefixes]
                                           [--cross-connection-name]
                                           [--customer-asn]
                                           [--force-string {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                           [--ids]
                                           [--ip-version {IPv4, IPv6}]
                                           [--name]
                                           [--no-wait {0, 1, f, false, n, no, t, true, y, yes}]
                                           [--peer-asn]
                                           [--primary-peer-subnet]
                                           [--remove]
                                           [--resource-group]
                                           [--routing-registry-name {AFRINIC, ALTDB, APNIC, ARIN, LACNIC, LEVEL3, RADB, RIPENCC}]
                                           [--secondary-peer-subnet]
                                           [--set]
                                           [--shared-key]
                                           [--subscription]
                                           [--vlan-id]

commands.name: az network cross-connection peering wait
commands.summary: Place the CLI in a waiting state until a condition is met.
